<h5 class="items-cat-title items-cat-title-h5">office</h5>
<h6 class="items-cat-title items-cat-title-h6">@RepAndyBiggsAZ</h6>
<ul class="tweet-list">
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">Welcome to the @HouseScience Environment Subcommittee hearing, entitled "Leading the Way: Examining Advances in Environmental Technologies."</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:04 AM via TweetDeck</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepAndyBiggsAZ/statuses/877527562477502465" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">@HouseScience W/o accurate atmospheric monitoring, we simply have no good way to predict weather &amp; no ability to ensure that citizens are kept out of harm</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:04 AM via TweetDeck</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepAndyBiggsAZ/statuses/877527705977311232" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">@HouseScience For a @HouseScience hearing such as this one, one avenue of undeniable importance is atmospheric monitoring.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:05 AM via TweetDeck</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepAndyBiggsAZ/statuses/877527792308584448" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">@HouseScience In the federal government, @TheNOAAOnline is tasked with issuing forecasts that inform millions of Americans each day. @HouseScience</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:05 AM via TweetDeck</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepAndyBiggsAZ/statuses/877527897355026432" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">@HouseScience @TheNOAAOnline .@TheNOAAOnline plays vital role in atmospheric monitoring/weather forecasting,but does it makes sense for NOAA to provide all weather data?</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:05 AM via TweetDeck</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepAndyBiggsAZ/statuses/877527973808791552" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">@HouseScience @TheNOAAOnline In the 21st century, the landscape has changed, and the federal government should not be the only game in town. @HouseScience</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:08 AM via TweetDeck</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepAndyBiggsAZ/statuses/877528657488744450" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">@HouseScience @TheNOAAOnline Partners in the private sector can-&amp; should-use their advanced &amp; innovative technologies to better our weather predictions. @HouseScience</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:09 AM via TweetDeck</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepAndyBiggsAZ/statuses/877528887491735552" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">

    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">Delaney Introduces Bill to End Gerrymandering, Reform Elections https://t.co/bZjmPB3wd2 https://t.co/dqnNHSU7nj</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:19 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877531442410115072" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">The Open Our Democracy Act has a very simple goal – to make the House of Representatives truly representative.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:39 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877536406704402432" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">Gerrymandering, low voter turnout and a broken primary system have warped Congress and encouraged extreme partisanship</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:39 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877536555841323009" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">In too many districts, the only election that matters is the primary</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:40 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877536800251797504" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">and that means a small and disproportionately partisan percentage of the population has an outsized influence on Congress</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:41 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877536943449550850" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">The American people are deeply frustrated because they can see that Congress just doesn’t reflect the country’s priorities.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:42 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877537111443951617" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">My bill ends partisan gerrymandering nationwide, helps more people vote by making Election Day a holiday and creates open top-two primaries</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:43 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877537359335751680" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">This is a comprehensive reform bill to ensure that the districts are fair and that all voters are heard.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:43 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877537469390049282" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">

    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 10:44 AM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/RepJohnDelaney/statuses/877537831874375685" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>

  <li class="tweet-item">

    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">That’s why I’ve pushed back against several high-profile media mergers and acquisitions. https://t.co/ms7cqIpfdQ</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 04:01 PM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/SenFranken/statuses/877617466867945472" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">So when news broke that AT&amp;T was proposing to purchase Time Warner for more than $85 billion, it raised some immediate flags for me.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 04:01 PM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/SenFranken/statuses/877617554096701444" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">Deal this big would give 1 company cntrl over both content—like your favorite shows on HBO &amp; news programs—&amp; how that content is delivered.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 04:02 PM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/SenFranken/statuses/877617628889595904" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">That’s bad news for consumers, and that’s why I’m leading group of @SenateDems in urging @TheJusticeDept to closely scrutinize the proposal.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 04:02 PM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/SenFranken/statuses/877617739329716224" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">@SenateDems @TheJusticeDept Should @TheJusticeDept agree that harm would come to consumers as a result of this deal, my colleagues &amp; I urge DOJ to side with consumers. https://t.co/5UTqTFzoPf</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 04:04 PM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/SenFranken/statuses/877618226682843136" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">What do you call a bill that strips away protections for people—incl. kids—w/ preexisting conditions, like cancer? Say it with me now, MEAN! https://t.co/SiiPoAjENC</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 04:19 PM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/SenFranken/statuses/877621973244948480" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">What do you call a bill that will cause 23 million more people to be uninsured? MEAN.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">
      <span class="tweet-meta-span">Posted at 04:19 PM via Twitter Web Client</span>
      <a href="https://www.twitter.com/SenFranken/statuses/877622037262368768" class="tweet-meta-link">Link</a>
    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
    <p class="tweet-text">What about a bill that guts Medicaid (which covers 1 in 5 adult women &amp; pays for 1/2 of all births) to give tax breaks to richest few? MEAN.</p>
    <p class="tweet-meta">

    </p>
  </li>
  <li class="tweet-item">
